name: src/cache/cache.service.js
Cache
description:
# The cache service

This is a simple service for providing a cache system in the frontend. This
one is an object cache saving the values in an object. It will not be persitent
between requests.

name: getValue
description: Get a value from the cache

name: isCached
description:
Checks if a value is stored for the given key
Checking is not done via getValue method
reason: a value could be of type boolean and so not be handled proper

name: setValue
description: Set a value

name: checkKey
description: Check for the type of the key

name: validation
description: @type{Object} validation

name: updateConfigFieldsAndValidation

name: behaviour

Cache

name: src/validation/formValidation/condition.js
condition
description: The condition function provides a condition for validation of each field.

name: src/validation/formValidation/dispatchEvent.js
eventDispatch

name: src/validation/formValidation/feedbackDisplay.js
FeedbackDisplay
description:
This Class provides display functionality.
Is handles display of error messages and validation states of each field.

properties.defaultValue: look at getOptions-src-code, could not escape curly braces
properties.defaultRaw: look at getOptions-src-code, could not escape curly braces
properties.name: messageTemplate

name: getDefaultFieldOptions
description: The Default display options for each field.

properties.name: fieldShowState
properties.description:
: true - Sets display actions concerning each field directly.
Shows state on true, removes state on false.

properties.name: messageShow
properties.description:
: true - Enables displaying of message of field.
Shows message on true and invalid result.

properties.name: preferHTMLValidatorMessage
properties.description:
: true - Enables prefering message given in HTML over message
given by validator.

properties.name: setByValidatorOnly
properties.description:
Set by validator. Usage does not depend on validation result.
These declarations are taken to operate field state actions.

properties.name: setByValidatorOnly.fieldShowStateValidSel
properties.description: The given validator should sent a valid CSS selector String.

properties.name: setByValidatorOnly.fieldShowStateInvalidSel
properties.description: The given validator should sent a valid CSS selector String.

properties.name: setByValidatorOnly.fieldRemoveStateSel
properties.description: The given validator should sent a valid CSS selector String.

return.description: This data is used in {@link getValidationFieldConfig}.

name: setStatusInvalidAria
description: Manages aria status of field (WCAG).
see:
https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/ARIA21.html
used only if validation result is false

params.name: fieldIdForAriaUsage
params.description:
This could be necessary to define
if one message is used for several form fields.

name: removeStatusAria
description: Manages aria status of field (WCAG).

name: removeStatus
description: Removes status classes and aria attributes of a field.

name: removeStatusBySelector
description: Removes staus classes and aria attributes of dom elements.

params.name: selector
params.description: CSS selector to get dom element list.

name: getMessageId
description: Returns the message id.

name: checkMessageLocationDataFormat
description: Checks messageLocation data for its validity

unknown.tagValue:
{Object|null} - Breakpoint depended message location data.
If breakpoint is matched all properties defined in HTML for this breakpoint (via min-width property)
are returned otherwise null is returned.

return.description:
Breakpoint depended message location data.
If breakpoint is matched all properties defined in HTML for this breakpoint (via min-width property)
are returned otherwise null is returned.

name: getMessageInsertLocationData
description: Manages where to place the validator message.

name: removeMessageAndAccordingAriaAttrOfField
description: Removes message and according aria attribute of given field.

name: src/validation/formValidation/formValidation.js
FormValidation
description: This Class offers form validation via html driven setup combined with customized or default validators
examples:
<form id="form">

<input name="name" id="name"
data-validation='{
"validators": {
"required": { "message": "Required \"name\" not set" } },
"feedbackDisplay": {
"messageLocation": [ { "minWidth": 0, "insertTargetSelector": "[for=\"name\"]" } ]
}
}'
>

<button id="submit-btn" type="submit">Validate Form</button>
</form>

<script type="text/javascript">

var options = {
formId: 'form',
caching: false
}

var validationService = new FormValidation( options );

var form = document.getElementById( 'form' );

form.addEventListener( 'submit', function( event ) {
event.preventDefault();

validationService.validateForm().then( function( result ) {
console.log( '----->validateForm success', result );
form.submit();
} ).catch( function( result ) {
console.log( '----->validateForm fail', result );
} );

} );

</script>

params.name: options
params.description: The options to set. You have to set the form id for a minimal configuration setup.

params.name: options.stopValidationOnFirstFail
params.description: Stops further validation of field if one validator fails.

params.name: options.condition
params.description:
(default={@link condition})
This condition function provides a condition for each field validation.

params.name: options.Behaviour
params.description:
(default={@link Behaviour})
This Behaviour Class is setting up the validation behaviour for each field.

name: feedbackDisplay
description: {@link FeedbackDisplay}

name: cache
description:
{@link Cache}
cache set a to this context to make them public

name: config
description: {@link getValidationConfig}

name: configFields
description: {@link getValidationFieldConfig}

name: setValidationAndBehaviour
description:
Initializes the validation service
and field behaviour.

name: validation
description: {@link ValidationServiceDom}

name: init
description:
Does the required setup.
Set in extra part - why?
This allows to manipulate several objects for customization

name: getMergedOptions
description: Merges default options given options

name: getValidationConfig
description:
Fills up validation config of fields via data attributes of fields and Id of each field.
{@link ValidationService}
examples:
<input name="name" id="nameId"
   data-validation='{
          "validators": {"required": { "message": "This field is required" }
          }'>

{
    nameId: {
        required: { message: 'This field is required' }
    }
}

params.name: fields
params.description: Array of field references to dom

name: setValues
description:
Fills up the validation data values
(Id of fields with it's value).
This values are used to validate.
{@link ValidationService.validate},
({@link ValidationServiceDom.setValueByField},
{@link ValidationService.getValue} )

name: updateConfigAndValuesAndBehaviour
description:
This function should be called
if any input fields have been added or deleted.
or before a validation of the entire form starts (Its called by {@link validateForm} )

name: validateForm
description: This function is validating the entire form.

name: getDefaultValidationFieldConfig
description: The Default field config for each field.

return.description: This data is used in {@link getValidationFieldConfig}

name: getValidationFieldConfig
description:
Merges the default field config {@link getDefaultValidationFieldConfig}
for each field with the HTML given config.

params.name: fields
params.description: Array of field references to dom

name: src/validation/formValidation/getValidationFields.js
getValidationFields
description:
Returns all fields dom references of the form
considering the given condition.

params.name: validationAttr
params.description: validation attr (where validation data is stored)

name: src/validation/formValidation/resolver.js
Resolver
description: This Class provides resolver functionality

name: dispatchEvent
description: {@link dispatchEvent}

name: getValidationFeedbackData
description:
Merges validator feedbackData with HTML given feedbackData (stored in this.configFields) and returns the
resulting data object.

properties.name: result
properties.description:
merged HTML given data
(merged with default feedbackData {@link getValidationFieldConfig} )
and validator feedbackData

name: displayActionInvalid
description: This function provides validation invalid actions.

name: displayActionValid
description: This function provides validation valid actions.

name: getAddDataOfGroupMembers
description:
Collects values of group members of field (set by sendToValidatorDataGroupSel)
to give additional data to the validators

name: resolver
description:
This function resolves the validation of each field.
The validation resolver is providing a getValidation function.
The getValidation function is providing a promise object.
This promise object is used inside validation loop in
{@link ValidationService.validate}

name: src/validation/formValidation/validators/email.js
src/validation/formValidation/validators/required.js
required
description: The required validator.

name: src/validation/validation.service.dom.js
ValidationServiceDom
description:
# The validator service ext

This Class extends the validation.service
configuring the validators and a validationResolver. A config can look like this:

name: setValueByField
description: Set one value by field

name: src/validation/validation.service.js
ValidationService
setConfig
description: Set config

name: setResolver
description: Set resolver

name: setValues
description: Set all values

name: setValue
description: Set one value

name: getValues
description: Returns all values

name: getValue
description: Returns one specific value

name: getFields
description: Returns all configured fields

name: validate
description: Validate one field

name: validateForm
description: Validate the whole form

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "validation-service",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A validation service to run form inputs against validators.",
  "main": "dist/validation/validation.service.js",
  "author": "Marius Bscher <marius.buescher@denkwerk.com>",
  "license": "MIT",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "karma start --single-run",
    "doc": "esdoc",
    "watch": "webpack --progress --watch --colors",
    "start": "webpack-dev-server TODO: The web-dev-server is not running proper, have a look on the outcommented webpack.config part",
    "build": "webpack",
    "lint": "eslint src/**",
    "lint-report": "eslint src/** -o artifacts/eslint.html -f html",
    "lint-fix": "eslint src/** --fix"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "axe-core": "^2.6.1",
    "babel-core": "^6.24.1",
    "babel-istanbul": "^0.12.2",
    "babel-loader": "^7.0.0",
    "babel-plugin-istanbul": "^4.1.5",
    "babel-polyfill": "^6.23.0",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.24.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^4.12.0",
    "eslint-loader": "^1.9.0",
    "glob": "^7.1.2",
    "istanbul": "^0.4.5",
    "istanbul-instrumenter-loader": "^3.0.0",
    "jasmine": "^2.6.0",
    "jasmine-core": "^2.6.2",
    "karma": "^1.7.0",
    "karma-babel-preprocessor": "^6.0.1",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "^2.2.0",
    "karma-coverage": "^1.1.1",
    "karma-firefox-launcher": "^1.1.0",
    "karma-fixture": "^0.2.6",
    "karma-html2js-preprocessor": "^1.1.0",
    "karma-ie-launcher": "^1.0.0",
    "karma-jasmine": "^1.1.0",
    "karma-jenkins-reporter": "^0.0.2",
    "karma-json-fixtures-preprocessor": "0.0.6",
    "karma-phantomjs-launcher": "^1.0.4",
    "karma-safari-launcher": "^1.0.0",
    "karma-sinon": "^1.0.5",
    "karma-tape-reporter": "^1.0.3",
    "karma-viewport": "^0.4.2",
    "karma-webpack": "^2.0.3",
    "sinon": "^2.3.2",
    "webpack": "^2.6.1",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^2.9.1"
  }
}
